author: PTI
title: PCB warns pacer Muhammad Aamir to behave
text: PTI | October 18, 2015, 01.40 Muhammad Aamir Karachi : PCB chairman Shaharyar Khan has issued a clear warning to disgraced Pakistan pacer Muhammad Aamir that anymore misbehavior or attitude problem would not be tolerated from the young cricketer. Pakistan Cricket Board’s match referee fined Aamir 150 percent of his match fees for violating the code of conduct during a Quad-e-Azam Trophy qualifying match between Sui Southern Gas and PIA in Faisalabad. Aamir was docked for using abusive language and arguing with the PIA players including Test batsman Faisal Iqbal in the match that Sui Gas won. The PCB chief was clearly upset with Aamir's behavior who is presently on a rehabiliation program designed by the board for him, Salman Butt and Muhammad Asif after they completed their five-year bans for spot fixing in September.
